conclusion: Understanding the problem setup: missile launched to hit an aircraft, accelerates upward, then follows a curved trajectory.
Initial phase: missile accelerates uniformly upward with 10g until 5000 meters.
Using equations of motion to find time to reach 5000 meters.
Equation: h = (1/2) a t², solving for t gives t = 10 seconds.
Time to reach 5000 meters is 10 seconds.
Calculating velocity at 5000 meters: v = a t = 1000 m/s upward.
After 10 seconds, missile reaches 5000 meters with 1000 m/s upward velocity.
Gas expulsion direction changes to angle θ downward and to the right.
Thrust force remains constant, mass change and air resistance negligible.
Finding thrust force magnitude: F = 11000 N upward.
Thrust force changes direction to θ downward and to the right.
Resolving thrust force into components: F_x = 2000√30 N, F_y = 1000 N.
Net vertical force: F_y + mg = 2000 N downward.
Net horizontal force: F_x = 2000√30 N to the right.
Horizontal acceleration a_x = 20√30 m/s² to the right.
